CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;No violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Causal link;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In CARDINAL he stood trial for a drugs offence and was acquitted . He sued the ORG for compensation for the unfounded prosecution and pre - trial detention .

CARDINAL . The case came before ORG of GPE . By its judgments of DATE and CARDINAL September CARDINAL the court ordered ORG to compensate the applicant ’s non - pecuniary and pecuniary damage . The judgments became binding on DATE and DATE , but were not enforced immediately .
CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE was enforced on DATE when the ORG credited the judgment debt to the applicant ’s bank account .

CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE which was enforceable as of DATE was not enforced immediately . The writ of enforcement was sent by the court to the bailiff service DATE after the judgment had become final . On the same date the bailiff service returned the writ to the court as it lacked competence to enforce this judgment under the relevant provisions of LAW . DATE , i.e. on DATE , the applicant sent the relevant documents to ORG , and on DATE the judgment debt was credited to the applicant ’s bank account .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment in DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must honour a judgment in DATE .

CARDINAL . LAW allows a person to appeal in court against an authority whose actions breach his rights ( LAW . If the appeal is well - founded , the court will order the authority to make good the breach ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure empowers a court to upgrade the amount of a judgment debt , if a creditor so asks .
CARDINAL . LAW of the Civil Code obliges the ORG to compensate a person ’s non - pecuniary damage caused by a breach of his property rights .
